detaileddescription.para: Don't draw the series
Connect the points with lines
Draw columns
Chart types
Shift old data to the left and add the new one o the right
Add the new data in a circular way
Chart update mode for lv_chart_set_next
don't draw the last tick
draw the last tick
draw tick labels in an inverted order
Data of axis

Create a chart background objects
par
pointer to an object, it will be the parent of the new chart background
copy
pointer to a chart background object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the created chart background

Allocate and add a data series to the chart
chart
pointer to a chart object
color
color of the data series
pointer to the allocated data series

Add a cursor with a given color
chart
pointer to chart object
color
color of the cursor
dir
direction of the cursor. LV_CHART_CURSOR_RIGHT/LEFT/TOP/DOWN. OR-ed values are possible
pointer to the created cursor

Clear the point of a series
chart
pointer to a chart object
series
pointer to the chart's series to clear

Set the number of horizontal and vertical division lines
chart
pointer to a graph background object
hdiv
number of horizontal division lines
vdiv
number of vertical division lines

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *chart, lv_chart_axis_t axis, lv_coord_t ymin, lv_coord_t ymax)
memberdef.name: lv_chart_set_y_range

detaileddescription.para:
Set the minimal and maximal y values on an axis
chart
pointer to a graph background object
axis
LV_CHART_AXIS_PRIMARY_Y or LV_CHART_AXIS_SECONDARY_Y
ymin
y minimum value
ymax
y maximum value

Set a new type for a chart
chart
pointer to a chart object
type
new type of the chart (from 'lv_chart_type_t' enum)

Set the number of points on a data line on a chart
chart
pointer r to chart object
point_cnt
new number of points on the data lines

Initialize all data points with a value
chart
pointer to chart object
ser
pointer to a data series on 'chart'
y
the new value for all points

Set the value of points from an array
chart
pointer to chart object
ser
pointer to a data series on 'chart'
y_array
array of 'lv_coord_t' points (with 'points count' elements )

Shift all data right and set the most right data on a data line
chart
pointer to chart object
ser
pointer to a data series on 'chart'
y
the new value of the most right data

Set update mode of the chart object.
chart
pointer to a chart object
update
mode

Set the length of the tick marks on the x axis
chart
pointer to the chart
major_tick_len
the length of the major tick or LV_CHART_TICK_LENGTH_AUTO to set automatically (where labels are added)
minor_tick_len
the length of the minor tick, LV_CHART_TICK_LENGTH_AUTO to set automatically (where no labels are added)

Set the length of the tick marks on the y axis
chart
pointer to the chart
major_tick_len
the length of the major tick or LV_CHART_TICK_LENGTH_AUTO to set automatically (where labels are added)
minor_tick_len
the length of the minor tick, LV_CHART_TICK_LENGTH_AUTO to set automatically (where no labels are added)

Set the length of the tick marks on the secondary y axis
chart
pointer to the chart
major_tick_len
the length of the major tick or LV_CHART_TICK_LENGTH_AUTO to set automatically (where labels are added)
minor_tick_len
the length of the minor tick, LV_CHART_TICK_LENGTH_AUTO to set automatically (where no labels are added)

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *chart, const char *list_of_values, uint8_t num_tick_marks, lv_chart_axis_options_t options)
memberdef.name: lv_chart_set_x_tick_texts

detaileddescription.para:
Set the x-axis tick count and labels of a chart
chart
pointer to a chart object
list_of_values
list of string values, terminated with , except the last
num_tick_marks
if list_of_values is NULL: total number of ticks per axis else number of ticks between two value labels
options
extra options
